movies.title: Occasional Coarse Language
movies.plot: A group of women get together in front of the TV and talk about their sexual misadventures and problems. The main focus is a young troubled woman (Sara Browne), who has just broken up with her boy friend and moves into a vacant room with one of her friends (Astrid Grant). When she hears about the problems the friend is having with her boy friend (Michael Walker), she ends up dating him and ending her friendship. Meanwhile another man in her rooming house is bedding every woman he sees to get over his own broken relationship. But it is the women's sexual discussion that dominates the film.
movies.simplePlot: A group of women get together in front of the TV and talk about their sexual misadventures and problems. The main focus is a young troubled woman (Sara Browne), who has just broken up with ...

biography.bio: Sara Browne is an actress, known for Occasional Coarse Language (1998) and Life Support (2001).
biography.name: Sara Browne

biography.bio: Astrid Grant is an actress, known for Occasional Coarse Language (1998), Le dernier caravansérail (2006) and Les Naufragés du Fol Espoir (2014).
biography.name: Astrid Grant

biography.bio: Nic Bishop was born on September 19, 1973 in Swindon, England. He is an actor and producer, known for The Lears (2017), Woodlawn (2015) and Covert Affairs (2010).
biography.name: Nic Bishop

biography.bio: Michael Walker is an actor, known for Occasional Coarse Language (1998), Jacob (1994) and Brigade des mers (1996).
biography.name: Michael Walker

biography.bio: Lisa Denmeade is an actress, known for Occasional Coarse Language (1998).
biography.name: Lisa Denmeade

biography.bio: Michelle Fillery is an actress and producer, known for Occasional Coarse Language (1998), Goggles (2006) and The Last Supper (2009).
biography.name: Michelle Fillery

biography.bio: Belinda Hoare is known for her work on Occasional Coarse Language (1998), The Leaving of Liverpool (1992) and Babe, le cochon dans la ville (1998).
biography.name: Belinda Hoare

biography.bio: Shannon Faith is an actress, known for Occasional Coarse Language (1998).
biography.name: Shannon Faith

biography.bio: Scott Hailstone is an actor, known for Occasional Coarse Language (1998).
biography.name: Scott Hailstone

biography.bio: Samantha Wellington is an actress, known for Love in the First Degree (2004), Occasional Coarse Language (1998) and Farscape (1999).
biography.name: Samantha Wellington

biography.bio: Tai Scrivener is an actor and writer, known for VTV Your Channel (2015), Occasional Coarse Language (1998) and The Crop (2004).
biography.name: Tai Scrivener

biography.bio: Scott Moon is an actor, known for Occasional Coarse Language (1998).
biography.name: Scott Moon

biography.bio: Brian Hawkins is known for his work on Sunshine State (2002) and Occasional Coarse Language (1998).
biography.name: Brian Hawkins

biography.bio: Barry Divola is an actor, known for ABBA: Bang a Boomerang (2013) and Occasional Coarse Language (1998).
biography.name: Barry Divola

biography.bio: Louise Alston attended Australia's national film school, AFTRS. In the early 2000's she created and produced two television series (Variety Show at the End of the World and Brilliant Lives) and a pilot (SuperEwe). She also worked in theatre and short film. In 2006 she put together enough resources and favors to shoot her first feature All My Friends are Leaving Brisbane, which was released in Australian cinemas in 2007. It played in festivals around the world and had a cinema release in Denmark. Her next film, Jucy world premiered at the Toronto International Film Festival 2010.
biography.name: Louise Alston

laboratory: Atlab Film Laboratory Service, Sydney, Australia
